| A priestess of Ghaunadaur:* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

A **priestess of Ghaunadaur**, C, is a type of monster that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). A priestess of Ghaunadaur is a form of female [drider](/wiki/Drider_\(dNetHack\) "Drider (dNetHack)") that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry. Her counterpart is the [priest of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priest_of_Ghaunadaur "Priest of Ghaunadaur"), which is a form of [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(dNetHack\) "Shoggoth (dNetHack)").

A priestess of Ghaunadaur has similar attacks to those of a drider: a weapon attack, an offhand weapon attack, and a kick attack that can trap its target in a [web](/wiki/Web "Web"). Unlike the drider, the priestess of Ghaunadaur has a stronger bite that inflicts [corrosion](/wiki/Corrosion "Corrosion") rather than [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison"), and also has an [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic") passive attack and the ability to cast clerical [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). A priestess of Ghaunadaur possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

Eating a priestess of Ghaunadaur's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a chance of conveying [temporary](/wiki/Temporary_intrinsic "Temporary intrinsic") sleep resistance.

## Generation

Randomly generated priestesses of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Ghaunadaur](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghaunadaur "wikipedia:Ghaunadaur")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Drider](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drider "wikipedia:Drider")***

## Encyclopedia entry

Ghaunadaur, god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, is a peripheral member of the drow pantheon. He is worshiped mainly by disaffected drow, especially those warped into punishment forms and exiled by Lolth. The most powerful droven followers of Ghaunadaur are often former priestesses of Lolth, warped into drider form after failing one of their goddess's many tests.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Priestess_of_Ghaunadaur\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Priestess of Ghaunadaur

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
C priestess of Ghaunadaur (No tile)
Difficulty 25
Attacks Weapon 1d10 physical, Offhand Weapon 1d10 physical, Bite 3d8 corrosion, Kick 1d1 webbing, Cast 0d8 clerical spell, Passive 2d12 acid
C priestess of Ghaunadaur (No tile)
Difficulty 25
Attacks

Weapon 1d10 physical, Offhand Weapon 1d10 physical, Bite 3d8 corrosion, Kick 1d1 webbing, Cast 0d8 clerical spell, Passive 2d12 acid

Base level 18
Base experience 635
Speed 15
Base AC 2
Base MR 10
Alignment -15 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 500
Size medium
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep

A priestess of Ghaunadaur:

  • is omnivorous.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A priestess of Ghaunadaur, C, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. A priestess of Ghaunadaur is a form of female drider that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the encyclopedia entry. Her counterpart is the priest of Ghaunadaur, which is a form of shoggoth.

A priestess of Ghaunadaur has similar attacks to those of a drider: a weapon attack, an offhand weapon attack, and a kick attack that can trap its target in a web. Unlike the drider, the priestess of Ghaunadaur has a stronger bite that inflicts corrosion rather than poison, and also has an acidic passive attack and the ability to cast clerical monster spells. A priestess of Ghaunadaur possesses sleep resistance.

Eating a priestess of Ghaunadaur's corpse or tin has a chance of conveying temporary sleep resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated priestesses of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.

Origin

Ghaunadaur, god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, is a peripheral member of the drow pantheon. The most powerful droven followers of Ghaunadaur are often former priestesses of Lolth, warped into drider form after failing one of their goddess's many tests.

A '''priestess of Ghaunadaur''', {{magenta|C}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. A priestess of Ghaunadaur is a form of female [[Drider (dNetHack)|drider]] that serves Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded, as indicated by the [[encyclopedia]] entry. Her counterpart is the [[priest of Ghaunadaur]], which is a form of [[Shoggoth (dNetHack)|shoggoth]].

A priestess of Ghaunadaur has similar attacks to those of a drider: a weapon attack, an offhand weapon attack, and a kick attack that can trap its target in a [[web]]. Unlike the drider, the priestess of Ghaunadaur has a stronger bite that inflicts [[corrosion]] rather than [[poison]], and also has an [[acidic]] passive attack and the ability to cast clerical [[monster spell]]s. A priestess of Ghaunadaur possesses [[sleep resistance]].

Eating a priestess of Ghaunadaur's [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a chance of conveying [[Temporary intrinsic|temporary]] sleep resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly generated priestesses of Ghaunadaur are always created hostile.
